message.start_with_gj: Please enter your student ID beginning with GJ.

rule.1: ◆ Do not bring food and drinks into the study area. Students are responsible for keeping the study room clean and tidy.
rule.2: ◆ Students should take good care of their personal belongings (such as wallets, phones, and computers). Valuable items should be carried or locked in a secure place. When leaving the classroom, students should take their valuable items with them, as the school does not assume any responsibility for their safekeeping.
rule.3: ◆ After leaving public areas, students should take their personal belongings with them. The administrative office will periodically clean the area, and the school will not be responsible for any lost items.
rule.4: ◆ Students should consciously maintain the cleanliness of the classroom and public order.
rule.5: ◆ Please take care of and use the teaching equipment responsibly. If any problems or losses are discovered, contact the administrative office as soon as possible. If a student causes equipment loss or maliciously damages the equipment, the student will be responsible for compensation.
rule.6: ◆ When students leave the classroom, they should ensure that all electrical equipment (such as air conditioners, fans, and lights) is turned off, and the remote control is returned to the designated location.
rule.7: ◆ Students are not allowed to move teaching equipment without permission.
rule.8: ◆ Do not reserve seats in any way. If students need to leave their seats, they should take their personal belongings with them, or place their books in their bags and put them under the desk without affecting other students' use of the seat. The duty teacher will periodically inspect the area, and any reserved items found will be removed or taken away to make the seat available for others.
rule.9: ◆ Be mindful of public decency and personal image, and do not lie down on benches or sofas.
rule.10: ◆ Do not speak loudly in public places, and set your phone to silent mode. Please go outside to make phone calls.
rule.11: ◆ It is forbidden to pull power sources privately or use high-powered electrical appliances. Do not move fire safety equipment without permission.
rule.12: ◆ At any time, the study area must not be used for non-study-related activities (including but not limited to video games on phones/computers, board games, watching variety shows or movies, etc.). Violation of these rules will be handled according to the 'Student Violation Management Regulations' based on the actual situation.

application.name: Name

tooltip.name: Your Chinese name and English name (e.g. 山姆 Sam).
tooltip.campus: Campus to which you are applying.
tooltip.room: Room to which you are applying.
tooltip.reason: Reason of reservation (e.g. I wanna practise my TOEFL test).
tooltip.checkbox: You will need to follow the rules of the classroom to make an application.

application.fix_problem: We are trying to fix this problem.

table.enter_keyword: Enter a keyword to start your search.

tooltip.result: The search will show results before and after three hours.

tooltip.name: Your Chinese name and English name (e.g. 山姆 Sam).
tooltip.campus: The campus where the maintenance was reported.
tooltip.subject: The subject of your report (e.g. AC Doesn't Work).
tooltip.location: The location you want to report for maintenance (e.g. The classroom).
tooltip.detail: The details of your report (e.g. We can not turn on the AC).

lostnfound.name: Your Chinese name and English name (e.g. 山姆 Sam).
lostnfound.type: The type of your Lost & Found request.
lostnfound.campus: The campus where the Lost & Found was requested.
lostnfound.location: The location you want to request for Lost & Found (e.g. The classroom).
lostnfound.detail: The details of your request (e.g. I found an Apple Pencil).
lostnfound.time: The time at which the item is recognized (e.g. 4.p.m. at Nov. 13th).
lostnfound.reward: If you want to put some reward on the item, please fill in this field.
lostnfound.alternative_contact: Set up an alternate contact so that people can reach you more easily.

clue.campus: The campus where the Clue is reported.
clue.location: The location you want to report for Clue (e.g. The classroom).
clue.detail: The details of your Clue (e.g. I found a pen).
